function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"AI-powered applications for risk forecasting, simulation, and modeling of COVID-19 spread may have inaccuracies leading to misinformed decisions.","Impact":"Inaccurate forecasts may result in ineffective management of COVID-19 spread and resource allocation.","Mitigation":"Regular validation and calibration of AI models with real-world data, and human oversight of AI-generated recommendations.","Technologies":"AI validation and calibration tools.","People":"Public health offices, policymakers, and decision-makers.","Owner":"Public health offices, AI developers."},{"Description":"Utilizing IoT, mobile, and surveillance camera data for tracing and warning about social distancing and wearing masks may infringe upon privacy rights and lead to surveillance concerns.","Impact":"Privacy breaches, distrust in public health measures, and social tension.","Mitigation":"Anonymizing data, obtaining consent for data usage, transparent communication about data collection and usage.","Technologies":"Privacy-preserving IoT, mobile app consent management tools.","People":"General public.","Owner":"Public health offices, data privacy regulators."},{"Description":"Utilization of drones, robotics, and image processing technologies for identifying high-risk zones may lead to public anxiety and distrust.","Impact":"Increased fear, distrust in technology, and social tension.","Mitigation":"Transparent communication about the purpose of the technologies, public education on their use, and privacy protection measures.","Technologies":"Privacy-preserving image processing, public education platforms.","People":"General public.","Owner":"Public health offices, technology developers."}]}
